subject: Volleyball
Colleges and Universities
Suits and Litigation
lead_paragraph: Quinnipiac reinstated its women’s volleyball team and dropped men’s indoor track in response to last week’s injunction issued in a gender equity lawsuit against the university. United States District Judge Stefan Underhill prevented the university from carrying out plans to eliminate the volleyball program, a move announced in March as part of budget cuts that also saw the elimination of men’s outdoor track and golf.
